@comment: Insérer cette section après 'm0:futureExtensions' et avant 'm0:summary'

m0:bicephalousAnalysis.description: Dual perspective analysis of Color Synthesis - Mathematical (Eagle) + Philosophical (Lion)

measurements.note: Same Territory (perceived color) for all 4 procédés
measurements.interpretation_quantitative: CMYK best practical model (smallest gap), RGB/HSL similar quality

formulas.CMYK_blackGeneration: K = min(C,M,Y); C' = C-K, M' = M-K, Y' = Y-K

mapTerritoryInsight.observation: Same Territory (perceived color), 4 different Maps (RGB, HSL, CMY, CMYK)
mapTerritoryInsight.korzybskiPrinciple: 'Map ≠ Territory' - each model is representation, not reality
mapTerritoryInsight.multipleMaps: No single 'correct' Map - appropriateness depends on medium and purpose
mapTerritoryInsight.constructivistValidation: Multiple constructions of same phenomenon are possible and valid

RGB.purpose: Display technology - matches human trichromatic vision
RGB.strength: Direct mapping to biological photoreceptors (L, M, S cones)

HSL.strength: Intuitive for humans (hue = color type, saturation = purity)
HSL.limitation: Not perceptually uniform (like RGB), computational overhead

CMY.limitation: Real pigments impure → CMY(100,100,100) = brown, not black

CMYK.strength: K channel solves CMY black problem + saves ink (40%)

observerDependence.insight: Same phenomenon, different optimal representation per observer

evolutionNarrative.biologicalConstraint: Human trichromacy (3 cone types) → RGB primaries
evolutionNarrative.insight: Models evolve from constraints (biological, physical, economic)

transdisciplinaryConnections.technology: Displays (RGB) vs Printing (CMYK) - medium shapes model
transdisciplinaryConnections.economics: K channel reduces costs → adoption driven by profit motive
transdisciplinaryConnections.design: HSL bridges engineering (RGB) and art (intuitive color)

RGB.why: 3 primaries insufficient to span all spectral colors
RGB.consequence: Highly saturated colors unreachable on displays

HSL.consequence: Equal HSL distance ≠ equal perceived difference

CMY.why: Real pigments not spectrally pure (absorption incomplete)

significance.pedagogical: Demonstrates Map-Territory distinction clearly (color = ideal teaching domain)
significance.practical: Guides model selection (RGB for screens, CMYK for print)
significance.transdisciplinary: Bridges physics, biology, psychology, technology, economics, design

binocularSynthesis.description: Integration of Eagle (measurement) + Lion (meaning) creates depth perception

depthPerception.principle: Epistemic gap ΔΘ as 'distance' between Map and Territory
depthPerception.stereoVision: Eagle quantifies gap, Lion interprets gap
depthPerception.depthInsight: CMYK closest to Territory (ΔΘ=0.27), but closeness is context-dependent
depthPerception.relativism: For displays, RGB better despite larger gap (medium-appropriate)

workflow: 1. Lion asks: What are we modeling? (Color perception) Why? (Display/Print needs)
2. Eagle measures: ASFID states for Territory and 4 Maps, calculate gaps
3. Lion interprets: ΔΘ_CMYK smallest (0.27) means 'best practical model for printing'
4. Eagle calculates: CMYK saves 40% ink vs CMY (economic validation)
5. Lion contextualizes: But for screens, RGB superior despite ΔΘ=0.35 (medium-appropriate)
6. Synthesis: Choose Map based on medium AND purpose, not gap alone

emergentInsights.lion: But RGB best for screens (medium-match), CMYK best for print (economics)
emergentInsights.synthesis: Smaller gap ≠ universally better - context matters

emergentInsights.lion: Same physical color, different perceptual organization
emergentInsights.synthesis: Multiple Maps can coexist without contradiction (perspectivism)

emergentInsights.lion: Economic pressure (ink cost) + physical limitation (pigment purity)
emergentInsights.synthesis: CMYK born from practical necessity, not theoretical elegance

emergentInsights.eagle: Designer uses HSL (perceptual), Printer uses CMYK (practical)
emergentInsights.synthesis: Model selection is act of observer, not property of Territory

binocularSynthesis.outcome: Quantified, contextualized, observer-aware understanding of color synthesis
